SENT.plain: Two rare cases of moyamoya disease developing total occlusion of the internal carotid artery are reported
Follow up cerebral angiograms demonstrated complete occlusion of the internal carotid arteries 4 and 15 years after initial angiograms
In these clinical circumstances it appeared that the whole cerebral blood flow was supplied entirely from the external carotid circulation
It has been thought that carotid occlusion was representative of the natural history of moyamoya disease
However, progressive total occlusion of the internal carotid artery has not previously been reported in this disease
This report provides an insight that proximal occlusion is the end-point of the disease
